attributes.action: Change Driving charges payment window from 24 hours to 7 days
attributes.additional_details:
I have had many fines for simply forgetting to pay within 24 hours or the next working day. But I always remember a couple of days later. The payment periods at present are arbitrarily and punitively short. 

Issuing a fine of up to £100 for forgetting to pay £5, or £2.50 within 24 or 48 hours should be illegal and there should be consumer protections in place to prevent such practice.
attributes.background: Change law to provide protection to consumers against arbitrary fines. Change to law to require 7 days for payment until fine is issued for airport drop off charges, ulez, congestion charge, dartford crossing and other driving charges.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/641332
